title: Enterprise Crypto Custody
summary: This course talks about the requirements, technology, and also some of the providers that provide crypto custody to Enterprises

topics.title: Intoduction
topics.details:
Enterprise stores crypto in a variety of ways, depending on the specific requirements of the organization. Some common methods include:

1. **Cold storage**: This involves storing the crypto offline, on a hardware wallet or paper wallet, to protect it from hacking and other online threats.

2. **Multi-sig wallets**: This involves using multiple keys to access the crypto, with each key held by a different person or department, to increase security and control.

3. **Custodial services**: This involves using a third-party service provider to securely store and manage the crypto on behalf of the enterprise.

4. **Hardware Security Modules**: This is a specialized, tamper-resistant hardware that stores the cryptographic keys used to access the crypto.

5. **A multiparty computation (MPC) wallet**: This technology enables multiple parties to jointly perform computations on sensitive data without revealing it to any of the parties involved.

In this course we will look at various ways enterprises can store their crypto and some of the most important requirements that enterprises have.

topics.title: Fireblocks
topics.details: Fireblocks is the digital asset storage, transfer, and issuance platform you can trust. With pioneering multi-layer security, financial institutions can easily enter the digital asset space and scale their services with speed and confidence. Fireblocks offers enterprise-grade wallet security, the industry’s only institutional digital asset transfer network, and a configurable governance framework to set risk and operational controls. Plus, they directly connect to major exchanges, OTC desks, and liquidity providers - so you can always get the best asset prices.

explanations.details: Fireblocks has a multi-layer security system that includes MPC, Intel SGX, a Policy Engine, and a deposit address authentication network. This ensures that users’ assets are protected from cyberattacks, internal collusion, and human error.
